decision_conditions:
An Environmental Impact Statement is not required for this proposal, in accordance with the Town and Country Planning (Environmental Impact Assessment) Regulations 2017. The development, whilst falling into Schedule 2's 'Description of Development 10 (b) (Infrastructure
Projects) 'Urban Development Projects', the scale and nature of the proposed development is such that it does not exceed 5 hectares of urban development, does not involve housing and would not have significant effects on the local environment to the extent that it would necessitate the submission of an EIA.
description:
Request for a Screening Opinion under the Town and Country Planning (Environmental Impact
Assessment) Regulations 2017 as to whether the following proposals constitute Environmental
Impact Assessment (EIA) development: Redevelopment of the site involving the removal of the existing facades, refurbishment and renovation, reconfiguration of floorplates, new elevational treatments, extensions and the infilling of the courtyard space in order to increase office floorspace. The proposal also includes the creation of a new pedestrian connection between Islington High Street and Torrens Street, new public realm by pushing the building's western and southern facades back from the street, new entrances and access arrangements as well as the creation of new active frontages.
